channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Symphonic Capital unveils $13.5 million first fund to back digital health and fintech startups
item.description: Symphonic Capital has closed its $13.5 million first fund, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: The Case for Giving This Trade War a Chance
item.description: Oren Cass argues tariffs are worth it.

item.title: Goldman Sachs pulled its recession call moments after Trump pressed pause on tariffs. Moody’s chief economist isn’t convinced: ‘I take no solace in the president’s announcement’
item.description: Markets are bouncing back, but not everyone is so relieved.

item.title: The Fed’s Tom Barkin is a former McKinsey CFO. Here’s his advice on how to ride out a crisis
item.description: There's currently a "deep fog of uncertainty" that's surrounding businesses, said Barkin, CEO of the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond.

item.title: Trump’s Encouragement of Stock Investors Draws Scrutiny
item.description: Was the president manipulating the market with his comments, as his critics say, or reassuring Americans, as the White House maintains?

item.title: Get ready to pay more than $2,000 for a new iPhone: Experts say Trump’s 125% tariff on China is a ‘complete disaster for Apple’ akin to ‘Armageddon’
item.description: Trump's 125% tariff on China could soon make the latest iPhone unattainable for most Americans, experts warn.

item.title: The Biden administration gave TSMC billions to build its semiconductors in the U.S., but Trump says he threatened 100% tariffs and got the company to double down
item.description: TSMC announced an additional $100 billion investment in the U.S. in March.

item.title: Hundreds of Israeli Air Force Reservists Call for Halt to Gaza War
item.description: A letter signed by reservists and retired officers accused the government of endangering hostages held by Hamas, highlighting a growing divide over th...

item.title: Ahead of the Masters, Golfers and Fans Load Up on Allergy Medication
item.description: The grass and trees at Augusta National Golf Club help make the course a treasure — but also an allergy nightmare.

item.title: The Damage From Trump’s Tariff Pause Is Already Done
item.description: The reciprocal tariffs might be gone for now, but slow growth, inflation and dings to American credibility remain.

item.title: How Trump’s Auto Tariffs Are Landing in an English Car Making Town
item.description: President Trump’s auto tariffs remain in place. In Solihull, where Jaguar Land Rover employs 9,000 people, residents are anxious about the 25 percent ...

item.title: Michelle Obama Addresses Divorce Rumors and Public Absences
item.description: The former first lady said on a podcast that people “couldn’t even fathom that I was making a choice for myself, that they had to assume that my husba...

item.title: Live Updates: E.U. Pauses New Tariffs on U.S. Goods After Trump Backs Down
item.description: The European Union said it wanted to give talks with President Trump a chance. Stocks in Asia and Europe rallied in response to the president’s change...

item.title: Hundreds of Israeli Air Force Reservists Call for Halt to Gaza War
item.description: A letter signed by reservists and retired officers accused the government of endangering hostages held by Hamas, highlighting a growing divide over th...

item.title: After Trump’s Pause on Tariffs, EU Delays Retaliation to Allow Talks
item.description: The bloc had voted to impose retaliatory measures just before President Trump made his last-minute U-turn. It has now announced a postponement.
